# Language Injection Test

This file tests syntax highlighting for various languages.

## Python (Should Work)

```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

def hello():
    print("Hello from Python")
    return 42
```

## R (Testing)

```r
# R code
library(ggplot2)
x <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
mean(x)

plot <- ggplot(data) +
  geom_point(aes(x, y))
```

## SQL (Testing)

```sql
-- SQL query
SELECT id, name, email
FROM users
WHERE active = true
ORDER BY created_at DESC
LIMIT 100;
```

## JavaScript (Should Work)

```javascript
const x = 42;
const greeting = "Hello";

function sayHello(name) {
  console.log(`${greeting}, ${name}!`);
}
```

## Quarto Executable Cells

### Python Executable

```{python}
import numpy as np
result = np.array([1, 2, 3])
print(result.mean())
```

### R Executable

```{r}
x <- c(1, 2, 3)
mean(x)
```

### SQL Executable

```{sql}
SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 10;
```
